quote: Drawing includes three and a half quarters of the content of painting. Drawing contains everything, except the hue.
author: Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres

quote: I draw like other people bite their nails.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: I sometimes think there is nothing so delightful as drawing.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: All the visible world is only light on form.
author: Andrew Loomis

quote: One must always draw, draw with the eyes, when one cannot draw with a pencil.
author: Balthus

quote: It is only by drawing often, drawing everything, drawing incessantly, that one fine day you discover, to your surprise, that you have rendered something in its true character.
author: Camille Pissarro

quote: Drawing is vision on paper.
author: Andrew Loomis

quote: I love the quality of pencil. It helps me to get to the core of a thing.
author: Andrew Wyeth

quote: Photography is an immediate reaction, drawing is a meditation.
author: Henri Cartier-Bresson

quote: Learning to draw is really a matter of learning to see - to see correctly - and that means a good deal more than merely looking with the eye.
author: Kimon Nicolaides

quote: Drawing is rather like playing chess: your mind races ahead of the moves that you eventually make.
author: David Hockney

quote: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
author: John Singer Sargent

quote: Drawing is the basis of art. A bad painter cannot draw. But one who draws well can always paint.
author: Arshile Gorky

quote: Drawing is the artist's most direct and spontaneous expression, a species of writing: it reveals, better than does painting, his true personality.
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Drawing is not what one sees but what one can make others see.
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Drawing is putting a line (a)round an idea.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: In drawing, nothing is better than the first attempt.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: In drawing, one must look for or suspect that there is more than is casually seen.
author: George Bridgman

quote: If you can draw well, tracing won’t hurt; and if you can’t draw well, tracing won’t help.
author: Bradley Schmehl

quote: The important thing is to keep on drawing when you start to paint. Never  graduate from drawing.
author: John Sloan
